H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1549.def: = small, flat tablet, ◄ probably made of wood or metal, ► on which words were scratched with a {L:stylus<SDBH:חֶרֶט>}

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H2747.def: meaning not completely sure: = object; ► used as tool in the process of molding images

H4122.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:prophet<SDBH:נָבִיא>} {L:Isaiah<SDBH:יְשַׁעְיָהוּ>}, ► whose name had a prophetic significance

H5749.def: = action with which a person gives evidence or proof of something, often as a witness in a legal setting ► the witness can be favorable or unfavorable

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5707.def: = a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

H223.def: = man; ◄ {L:Hittite<SDBH:חִתִּי>}; ► warrior; husband of {L:Bathsheba<SDBH:בַּת־שֶׁבַע>}; killed on the authority of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H3000.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► father of the {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>} {L:Zechariah<SDBH:זְכַרְיָהוּ>}; time of {L:prophet<SDBH:נָבִיא>} {L:Isaiah<SDBH:יְשַׁעְיָהוּ>}

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H5031.def: = female person speaking on behalf of a deity

H2029.def: = process by which someone becomes pregnant

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H4122.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:prophet<SDBH:נָבִיא>} {L:Isaiah<SDBH:יְשַׁעְיָהוּ>}, ► whose name had a prophetic significance

H2962.def: = a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H1834.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Syria<SDBH:אֲרָם>}; ► capital of one of the {L:Aramaean<SDBH:אֲרָם>} kingdoms

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3282.def: = a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7975.def: = pool in Jerusalem receiving water from the Gihon spring

H4885.def: poetic term; = state in which humans, deities, and animals feel and show great joy

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H6099.def: = state in which humans or animals are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H650.def: = river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4298.def: = process by which a bird or other flying creature extends its wings in order to fly

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H4393.def: = a certain quantity that fill a certain container

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6005.def: = man; ◄ possibly son of {L:Ahaz<SDBH:אָחָז>} or {L:Isaiah<SDBH:יְשַׁעְיָהוּ>}; ► whose birth was foretold by the {L:prophet<SDBH:נָבִיא>} {L:Isaiah<SDBH:יְשַׁעְיָהוּ>} as a sign to {L:Ahaz<SDBH:אָחָז>}; often taken as a reference of the {L:Messiah<SDBH:מָשִׁיחַ>}

22.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H2865.def: = state in which the surface of the soil is broken into many pieces

H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H247.def: = to wear a belt or girdle around one's waist

H5779.def: = action by which two or more people discuss the best way forward

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2393.def: = state in which humans are strong in political sense

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H6942.def: = action by which humans that are part of a {L:holy<SDBH:קָדֹושׁ>} nation set themselves apart from others by not engaging in activities that are not in accordance with God's law

H6206.def: = process by which humans experience an extreme fear

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H5063.def: = a stone that is positioned in such a way that the foot of travellers may come in forcible contact it, ► which may result in stumbling and injury; ≈ usually used in a figurative way to denote sustaining any kind of hardship in life

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H4383.def: = an obstacle that causes humans to trip or temporarily lose their balance when hitting it with their feet; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H6341.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H4170.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3369.def: = causative action by which someone places a net or trap in such a way that it is not readily seen ► for the purpose of catching animals and birds; ≈ associated with aggression and oppression

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H3928.def: = state in which animals have adapted themselves to the conditions of a certain environment

H2442.def: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3206.def: = posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H226.def: = an object that represents and identifies a group of people; in the form of a flag or a metal or wooden board, often with an image; attached to a pole so that it can be carried; used in both military and religious contexts

H4159.def: = object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H178.def: = container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine; ≈ known to be able to burst when too full of new wine

H3049.def: = spirit of a dead person, ► consulted by fortune-tellers; ≈ an activity forbidden in the law of Moses

H6850.def: = action by which birds, but also, in a derogatory way, to ghosts and mediums produce high-pitched sounds

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7837.def: = the first appearance of light in the sky in the early morning

H7185.def: = process by which humans experience an event as difficult to handle or hard to accept

H7457.def: = condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

H7456.def: = to be in a state of wanting or needing food, but having little to no access to food

H7107.def: = process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H2825.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, and fear

H4588.def: literally: darkness; hence: = state of absence of well-being, ≈ commonly associated with darkness

H5080.def: = state in which one's hand, which holds an instrument like an axe, is raised ► with the purpose of striking it against another object

H653.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and lack of wisdom
